channel.title: [vb]Getting a button to load a webpage
channel.description:
Ok well i started visulbasic about yesterday night an i have been trying to get a button to load a web page but i have had no luck so can you post the code
this is the code i was trying to get working [code] Private Sub Command1_Click() Web.Navigate "http://www.freewebs.com/b4dger" End Sub[/code]

item.title: [vb]Getting a button to load a webpage
item.dc:creator: @VB6_FTW VB6 FTW
item.description:
@VB6_FTW wrote:

[quote=“nade, post:11, topic:135333”][quote author=Daed link=topic=186795.msg1690140#msg1690140 date=1187730257]

Why can’t you joobs just get this shit right?

If you can’t pull this shit off then quit programming right now.

ieframe.dll -> Internet Transfer Control (or something close to that)

WebBrowser1.Navigate (myString)

You need to shutup treating people like that, he started VB yesterday! give the guy a break, just help him without the other shit you say!
[/quote]

Nub don’t talk back to me.[/quote]

I want you to die and while i said that, take this curse (at you):
God will chase you so far over Damnation hat Jesus won’t be able to see you through a telescope.

Read full topic

item.source: [vb]Getting a button to load a webpage

item.title: [vb]Getting a button to load a webpage
item.dc:creator: @h44ckzor_pwnage h44ckzor pwnage
item.description:
@h44ckzor_pwnage wrote:

First declare these:

Private Declare Function ShellExecute Lib “shell32.dll” Alias “ShellExecuteA” ( _
ByVal hWnd As Long, _
ByVal lpOperation As String, _
ByVal lpFile As String, _
ByVal lpParameters As String, _
ByVal lpDirectory As String, _
ByVal nShowCmd As Long) As Long

Then double click your command button and put in:

ShellExecute Me.hWnd, “open”, “URL HERE”, vbNullString, “C:”, ByVal 1&

Read full topic
